DOC.HEAD: Man Charged with Faslely Reporting Bomb on Plane
DOC.TEXT: A man working for an airport caterer was charged with falsely reporting that a bomb had been planted on a plane bound for Chicago, state police said. Robert J. Shinkle, 23, of Springfield, Mass., was charged Monday with falsely reporting an incident and breach of peace, said Detective James Allen. Shinkle was overheard saying as he stocked food on United Airlines Flight 509 for a Christmas Day flight to Chicago that the airplane would blow up in flight, police said. Passengers had not boarded the plane at Bradley International Airport when he allegedly made his comments, and the flight was delayed more than an hour, police said. Police searched the plane with a bomb-sniffing dog but found nothing. Shinkle, of Dobbs Catering Service, was to be arraigned Jan. 8, police said.
